alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 7:02PM EST until January 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of one- tenth of an inch to one-quarter of an inch. * WHERE...In Virginia, Shenandoah, Frederick VA, Warren and Clarke Counties. In West Virginia, Jefferson County. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation is expected to begin as snow between 7 and 10 AM. The snow will mix with and likely change to sleet and freezing rain during the afternoon, before ending during the early evening. The snow may be heavy at times during the early afternoon, with snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour briefly possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
